result.execSummary:
The defendant Raghib L Edmond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Court signed order partially granting request for sentence credit . Court orders the judgment of conviction to be amended to include ten days of sentence credit. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. mag
Additional Documents re: Request for Pretrial Incarceration Credit filed by Attorney Araiza
Letter to defense attorney requesting a copy of the revocation order and warrant in case 13CM004959.

Court will grant motion for expungement if defendant pays all costs, fees and DNA surcharges, successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court ordered defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to condition time, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.  Court opposed electronic monitoring.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and DNA surcharges by 9/30/16 or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Court will grant motion for expungement if defendant pays all costs, fees and DNA surcharges, successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

Restitution is set $0.

Filed;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Raghib L Edmond in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Raghib L Edmond in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR. Case calendared for plea hearing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Raghib L Edmond not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea Hearing. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Raghib L Edmond in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Raghib L Edmond in custody.  
Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Raghib L Edmond
Current: 1919 N 11th Street Apt D19, Milwaukee, WI 53205   (Effective: 07-25-2015)
Prior: 2708 West Meinecke Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
